meanings.definition: Clothing that is worn-out or of poor quality.
meanings.sent1: She wore old duds to the party.
meanings.sent2: He donated his duds to charity.
meanings.sent3: The clown's duds were so big they made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense was a dud, always picking the worst duds.
meanings.sent5: The duds in the thrift store were a sad sight, hanging limply on the racks.

meanings.sent1: The movie turned out to be a real dud.
meanings.sent2: His plan to surprise her was a total dud.
meanings.sent3: The party was a dud, with no music or dancing.
meanings.sent4: The project was a dud, never taking off like they hoped.
meanings.sent5: The dud of a gift he gave her was quickly forgotten.

meanings.definition: A shell or bomb that fails to explode.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers found an unexploded dud in the field.
meanings.sent2: The bomb disposal unit safely removed the dud.
meanings.sent3: The dud bomb was a relief to the town, knowing it didn't go off.
meanings.sent4: The dud shell lay harmless in the sand, a reminder of the war.
meanings.sent5: The dud grenade was a lucky break for the soldiers, sparing them from harm.
